result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 08:59 AM Defendant Heidi C Geisler via video conference.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Request to change count 2 dispostion heard. Arguments. Court makes findings and denies request.

The 7/9/20 hearing is being held via video and telephone conferencing.  You may join this hearing by video using the following website: https://zoom.us/j/98901979226 (meeting ID: 989 0197 9226) or you may join the hearing by phone by calling 1-312-626-6799 (meeting ID: 989 0197 9226).
Hearing on July 9, 2020 at 08:15 am.

08:57 AM Defendant Heidi C Geisler via video conference.  Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State of Wisconsin via video conference. Defendant's requests for count 2 changed from dismissed and read in to dismissed. Defendant advises emailed attorney Gerol requesting to schedule phone conference and did not receive response. Court adjourns matter for parties to discuss request.  Hearing scheduled for July 9, 2020 at 08:15 am.

for Booking

Defendant Heidi C Geisler in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises victim rights were complied with and victim did not request to be present. Plea questionnaire filed. State files deferred prosecution agreement entered by parties. Court examines defendant, accepts plea of guilty. Court withholds finding of guilty. Court approves and signs agreement this date.
Per request of Atty McClendon and no objection by the State, status hearing removed from the calendar on 4/5/16 and change of plea scheduled for 4/12/16 at 1:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on April 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Heidi C Geisler by authorization with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts plea. State requests $500 signature bond with conditions. Counsel requests 48 hours to have defendant sign bail/bond form. Court so grants. Further proceedings scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
